intro: Oxalis commersonii, commonly known as the purple oxalis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are usually dark green with a reddish or purple hue. The plant produces clusters of small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Oxalis commersonii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
